intro: Navarretia klickitatensis, commonly known as the Klickitat lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and streambanks. It has hairy, ovate leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Navarretia klickitatensis is a short-lived perennial, often found in areas with cool, humid climates.
